I love the platanos and platano de empanadas, is my go to! Pupusas are great. Curtido is great, made the traditional way!  I recommend you call in to place your order. Is not that they are slow is just the food is great they get tons of orders. I love that its clean inside too. Yeah its located in not the best street but never been a problem for me. I recommend this place!<//Review>

<user>101680887019881172299<//user><username>Carlo N.< /username>< time>
1510472176617< /time>
<Rate>4</Rate>< Review>
Good Housekeeping bar offers good cocktails. This bar is associated with Cafe Birdie. Their speciality is cocktails so Beers are limited. It's a small dim lit bar that provide classy interior exposed brick wall and a full bar marble counter top table. Atmosphere is very very intimate. Music playlist match the atmosphere; loud enough to have a conversation. Staff are friendly. Prices are on the highend averaging $12. Outside seating is available. Plenty of parking.</Review>

<Text>First off, I never write reviews either good or bad. But I wanted to take the time to write this one as I felt it was important.

i reached out to Derrick Evans at Aligned Mortgage when I was going through a very rough start to a divorce and needed someone I could trust. What I needed was someone who could be direct, honest, and good a communicating through a process that was time sensitive and would give me piece of mind. Derrick first took the time to make sure what i was doing made sense - he did not just do what I asked, he took the time to make sure what I was doing was right and treated the situation as if he were in my shoes. He was honest with me and prepared me for the possible volatility we could see in the market and the effects if could have.

The whole team I worked with were professionals that knew we had to work fast and kept things moving. Derrick kept me calm, communicated when needed, and was constantly prepping me for next steps. Derrick also took the time to explain the process to my wife so that she could hear if first hand from a professional and know I was not doing something by the book - only a person who cares about clients will do that extra step.

I went this Friday to get tuna sandwiches. When I walked in, nobody was there, not even at the counter. Than, a lady came out from the back and her name was Brenda. Her host ID: 6656041069890886. She did not welcome us, seemed in a bad mood, and had a rude attitude. She did not let us speak and continuously asked if we were ready and done yet. She was in a huge rush and was being very rude. At the end, I asked for her name and host ID, and she was surprised as to why I was asking her. I told her I needed to talk to a manager, and she said the manager is not available. She explained that she charged everything all right, and she was was rushing my order because she didn‚Äôt have anybody‚Äôs help, she was working alone, and had a lot of orders. < text>
This is, hands down, the best cup of coffee I have EVER had, and I consider myself a coffee connoisseur. My only complaint is that they've ruined coffee at any other place. The care and expertise that these guys use when crafting dishes and drinks is unparalleled. The selection of beans that they use are the best in the biz. Coffee Bean is too sweet. This coffee is PERFECT.
Try it once and you'll take the trip, however far, to make this your everyday coffee stop.<//text>

<user_id>106754798092676279665< /user_id>< Text>
After coming back from my month long Australi trip, I've been searching for Australian coffee shops in LA and I finally found one! Roo Coffee is located in silverlake next to Pine and Crane. The cafe is small but they also have outdoor sitting area which is great when the suns out.
I tried their macadamia nut latte and it was SO GOOD! I'll definitely go back to try their other coffees.< /Text>
<user_name>Jennifer Kresmy< /user_name><GmapID>0x80c2c748095c83b3:0xeaadd1a435c131a8<//GmapID>< Rate>

<UserId.>116849946697029256338</UserId.><name>Shel D< /name>< time>
1522792471010</time>
<Rate>5<//Rate><Text>Incredible place!
Roo Coffee is located at the most unique place in Silver Lake. Street parking is manageable and since that section of the street is blocked off with giant flower pots no cars are allowed to drive in. It gives the public and chance to feel like they're in Europe and roam around freely. I've been to Brisbane, Australia before and given the fact that the owners are from there the whole cafe has that Aussie vibe, and of course menu.
Steve was the person who greeted me and talk about the best personality! I felt like I had known him for a long time. His approach was extremely genuine and friendly. He recommended I get the salted caramel smoothie along with a famous coffee drink with chocolate shaved on top ( the way Aussies drink it). So of course I went with his recommendations and ordered both. Shortly after both my drinks came out. They were both delicious, as Steve has promised. The smoothie was so decadent yet so light and full of flavor. The coffee with the shaved chocolate on top gave it a nice kick with every sip.
I was told that Roo coffee is known for their delicious food. Unfortunately the kitchen was closed so I didn't get a chance to try it. But fortunately I have more of a reason, as if I needed any more, to go back there again very soon :)<//Text><pics>None</pics>< resp>
None</resp>

115685520252172134086</user>
<Resp>None</Resp><Text>This coffee shop is small but such a gem. Super cute and trendy! Ambiance is tropical with Pastel colors. I got the fairy bread and the golden matcha iced latte, with oat milk. The latte has turmeric in it. When I got my latte, it tasted like a lot of turmeric and hardly any matcha. Nonetheless, the server added more milk / matcha and ended being great. The bread has colorful sprinkles and edible flowers on top of it. Aesthetically, it looked cute... Which is ultimately why I ordered it. When I took my first bite, I was shocked. So soft, buttery, and idk I feel like there is a hint of sugar added with the butter or something!!! Definitely not what I was expecting.
Also, the sprinkles melt into your mouth since the bread itself is heated and drenched with butter. Fairy bread INDEED! I tasted my friends blueberry muffin and I wasn't impressed. It tasted pretty dry and mediocre. I prefer my muffins much more moist. The customer service was awesome. All the servers and baristas were so friendly and kind. I would definitely come back!<//Text></record>

Lots of tendon and stuff between the bones. No bone marrow because it melted away. The best thing about it is the unbeatable $4 price! I tried both chicken and beef pho, and I prefer the beef. Only serves pho here, so look else where if you want something else.  Savory broth, generous portion of herbs, and the option to customize meat options.  Service is fast, sometimes too fast.  Not a place for a quiet leisurely meal. Overall a good option.<//Text>

Adele Davis<//Name>
<date>1556914151748</date><Rate>5< /Rate>< review>
My Husband got a flat on his way home from Orange County we didn't know what to do so I called Oceanside Cycle Supply and I told Jim what was happening and that we might get there a little after they close because he was waiting for the tow truck to come, Jim said no problem. So I showed up about 5 min before they closed to pick my husband up and Jim invited me in the office to sit down. The tow truck took 40 minutes longer then expected Jim graciously wait for almost an hour after closing so we didn't have to have the bike towed home then towed again the next day. They are great and really care about their customers. I highly recommend Oceanside Cycle Supply!</review>

< review>
Wednesday of last week on my way back to LA from San Diego, I had a flat tire on the 5 FWY and had to be towed from Del Mar  to Oceanside. We arrived at Oceanside Cycle Supply after closing, it was almost 6 PM so I was going to leave the bike and rent a motel room. When one of the mechanics, Michael, heard I was going to spend the knight, he offered to stay and change the tube and tire. This was accomplished with the assistance of his manager, Spence. To have a flat at that time of day and have a shop react the way they did makes for a very happy ending. It is great to find people that think outside the box. I made it home safely and slept in my own bed.<//review>

<time>1468070527174<//time><Name>Ethan< /Name>< review>
Took this bike in for a tune up. They charged me for new spark plugs during said tune up, and two days later my bike wouldn't start. I replaced the spark plugs and it started right up. I like to think that a mechanic should be able to change spark plugs properly if the shop charges 75 an hour for labor.
A few months later I gave them another chance and ordered a rear turning light. They ordered me the wrong one and Scott's explanation was that he can't see which Triumph part he's ordering so he has to guess. I wish he had told me that before I relied on them. I used the turning light because I needed it for the coast to coast trip I was taking the next day, so now I'm stuck with a turning light that doesn't match the others.
So if you want to have your bike worked on by unreliable mechanics, or you like the excitement of wondering if your going to get the right part or not come to Oceanside Cycle Supply where the service is always unreliable.< /review>

<Name>Philippe Roussel<//Name>< time>
1457025843570<//time>
<rating>5< /rating><Review>After being overcharged and my bikes butchered by local dealerships (Triumph 955i Tiger and BMW R1200GSA), I was so afraid of have a "pro" touching my Yamaha 1200 Super T√©n√©r√©, I was about to skip the 25,000 miles maintenance. In particular the valve adjustment, which is a delicate and potentially disastrous operation. But I have it done anyway, by a small local shop, specialized in used motorcycles resale: Oceanside Cycle Supply, Oceanside, CA. They have four (maybe 5) mechanics, all of them experienced by more than 10 years of practice. Although they have never touched a  Yamaha 1200 Super T√©n√©r√©, they took the job, pulled the manufacturer manual and did everything by the book. I think they spent way more time than they charged me, but the result is just perfect. All plastics were remounted right, no screw were marred or loose, all parts to be changed were replaced. I took the motorcycle for a 1700 miles ride just after, and the bike never seemed so powerful, and trouble free. So if you are looking to find a decent mechanic shop to do the job right for your motorcycle, here it is.<//Review><Pics>None</Pics><response>None< /response><Gmap_id>0x80dc6e1d2aed7db9:0xfba8387d702256a9</Gmap_id></record>

< text>
Dropped my bike off here to find out why I had no power going to my bike. Got a call over a week later telling me my rectifier and stater went and that with parts and labor it would be 650 dollars to fix. Obviously me knowing this is bullsit I went to pick my bike up. Got there as they were closing and found my bike jammed in there main room with about 30 other bikes. Once they pulled it out I found that the plastics werent put back together correctly and they were just hanging loosely missing screws. One guy played dumb saying that all they took off was the tank and yet the other guy told me he took off the whole left side. My bike also had and I swear on everything I love, at least 4 or 5 deep scratches that weren't there before. It was like the room off the plastics and through them on the ground or they scratched my bike up as they pulled it in and out of there tiny shop and probably scratched it up on Someone  else's bike. I went to San Diegos house of motorcycles and they fixed my bike for 400 that's parts labor and tax out the door verses this place charging me 650 - 700 is what the quote I got over the phone. DO NOT GO HERE. They treat your bike like it's some toy seriously the worst expiriance I've ever had with bike shops. Can't get over how pissed I was when I saw how scratched up my bike was. STAY AWAY!!!!</text>

< review>
I've never been to this nail shop before. My regular nail tech was booked, I needed something asap. So I decided to give Meridian a shot since all of the other local nail shops were extremely busy. The lady that did my manicure asked what color Gel I wanted, so I told her she grabbed the color No problem. She painted my Nails they were perfect. Lastly the lady that did my pedicure was also great but when she was done polishing my toes they were very streaky. I asked if she could even out the color. She looked upset and said this color(Yellow) is very hard to work with. She said "I can add 1 more coat". I told her that I wanted all of my nails to look the same and she just looked so upset. She did fix it. I would have just appreciated her telling me from the beginning that she didnt know how to work with the color I wanted. I've had Yellow nails before and its never been a problem.</review>

< text>
What a delicious place to eat with friends! A group of us stopped by for dinner; we ordered different dishes to try them out. The food was fresh, their salads very tasty and their meats had delicious seasonings and flavor. We stayed a long time because the service was excellent (very friendly servers) and we really felt welcome. Their prices were the most surprising thing as each plate was around $10 and most restaurants in the area charge $16 and up. We had a really great time!<//text>

Only one person to take the orders, serve , pack etc. Also they did not tell if it is going to take longer. Nothing was ready, they were frying falafel then and there, there were no pita. While taking the order they did not write the options and while serving other customers, they were asking about what do we want. The only one lady at the counter was running here and there. I saw how unhygienic the counter was. She put my pita sandwich on the counter, her hands were all filled with some sauce . And when we got our order the packet had all the sauce from her hands. It was grose.
I would have not written this review until I found a stapler pin in my mouth.
This place really needs some check and better service

And you can see all the reviews on google and on Yelp too, the business owner is not ready to accept any bad reviews or rather any suggestions.
If there is a problem with their service or delivery they should accept it. They are rather denying everything saying that these are false claims. <rating>2</rating>< Text>
The bread and schug (green hot sauce) was very good.

The hummus was absolutely awful -- grey, slightly off flavor.

The tahini was bitter and bland. The cabbage salad was ok, but too much onion and under-seasoned. The fava beans were bland and tasted maybe a little off.

The shawarma was palatable, but in no way resembled shawarma -- more like a somewhat bland curry?

I now know that there is at least one thing that any Israeli or Palestinian can agree on: There is no reason to ever eat at this restaurant.

PS: It used to be good, if memory serves me... Not sure what happened.</Text>

<Name>Yogini Mudafale<//Name><Rate>5</Rate><Pictures>[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipOrq5TXmomrumPFH4YcB16V3tlGrAIXxcLayari=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipPcNIiSXE2O1ovlGpe8eIeQcHEqAd6StEJiNTiP=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipMHt3sVlFDFOLUsKfE38aw3R7jezCF2GnATa5lN=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipNnoaDe3tN0Ed8NRBhMLXEc4oBaV8xk_mUr0-sn=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]< /Pictures></record></dataset><record>
<time>1573939815792<//time>< name>
John Wie<//name>
< Pics>
None< /Pics>
<review>Hummus and schnitzel have rarely been so delicious as at Village Hummus. What a random but great find thanks to Yelp.

You'll see Village Hummus tucked into a mall/apartment complex with some limited street parking. Come in and the store looks fairly inconspicuous - a few tables (it's fairly small). Order at the counter with a few different variations on the dishes like pita variations to plate variations - it's a super straightforward menu. I went with the schnitzel and hummus for about $9ish.

When the plate came out, you get a good amount of food. Along with the hummus/schnitzel you'll get a couple big pita breads, chopped salad, pickles, tahini and lemon relish. You can also get the optional hot sauce dip (forgot the exact name here) which is actually pretty spicy but deliciously so. The hummus is plentiful and is made just right. The schnitzel is also fairly large and delicious.

Staff was super kind with some limited drink options. Definitely seems like a neighborhood kind of vibe. Really enjoyed it and hope to come back again soon when I'm in the area.<//review><Response>None<//Response>< GmapID>

<user_id>105461306742599844177<//user_id><rating>5</rating><response>None</response><Name>Sophia Yuen< /Name>< pics>

< review>
I really try not to go back to the same place twice, but I was in the area and remembered how good this place good and wanted the hummus that I couldn't get last time because I couldn't eat 2 meals.

So I came back and got the hummus with ground beef. It's comes with pita and it's pretty much a meal in itself. The hummus is so smooth, the ground beef is flavorful and delicious and there's something about that green hot sauce that is super spicy, but its SO good!

Overall, I just kept ripping up my pita and scooping some beef and hummus and repeating. It's so good! I'll probably end up back there again.< /review>

< username>
Madhuja Samaddar</username>
<Text>Tiny menu but we loved the food both times that we were there! I could come here just for their pita which is unlike any other pita I've ever eaten : soft, fluffy, done just right and always fresh and warm. It was a bit disappointing that the only shawarma they serve is chicken but then we were really happy with what we got in terms of taste, quality and portion (honestly though, it was more like curry than shawarma). Between both visits we've almost sampled the entire menu. The tastes and styles are slightly different from other 'mediterranean' places. Come here for a great tasting, affordable and healthy meal! One star off for the limited seating options :(< /Text><UserId.>110421838126607308781</UserId.>< date>

< review>
A cute little mom&pop mediterranean joint in the Hillsdale neighborhood. I've tried their falafel and the chicken in a pita sandwich and both were amazing. The best part about this pita is the stuffing. The ratio of the veggies, chicken and sauce was just perfect and it was also well distributed across the entire pita which makes the sandwich way better than others.</review>

5</rate>
< text>
The customer service and location of this wonderful hotel was fantastic. Stayed for the weekend and had room service breakfast. We ordered corned beef hash and super omelet with swiss cheese, sausage and spinach. It was made fresh, very fast, and it was surprisingly affordable!!! The front door concierge made our stay obsolete by allowing us to park in the front with no extra charge. I would definitely reccomend anyone to book a stay at this fabulous sf hotel.<//text>

<user_id>113049053982742054659< /user_id><Name>Andreana Trombetti< /Name><Time>1620796428245< /Time><Rating>5</Rating><review>Amazing views of the city! Loved our patio area to have our coffee in the morning and Cali cabernet in the evening. The view of the bay bridge was stunning. The bed was so comfortable, we actually would love to know the kind of pillows used so we can buy some! The staff was so accomodating with our early check in and holding our bags after check out so we could walk the city before our flight out. I was especially impressed with how clean the bathroom was in our room. Just wished the bar was open for us a little later but everything in town seemed to close a little early due to covid. Also, really wanted to enjoy room service but with all the fees it was more beneficial to just walk down the street for some food. Other than that, highly recommend! <time>1562098454962</time><rate>5</rate><Review>Just like the city around this hotel, Le Meridien was a very welcoming and enjoyable place to stay. From the moment of arrival, the appearance and amenities are subtly extravagant. It was refreshing to have the luxury feel that didn't rely on gaudy marble or accents. A comfortable and modern lobby and lounge provided a great place for relaxing, meeting up with others, and just enjoying conversation. The attendants at the front desk were prompt, professional, and welcoming.

The Concierge deserves their own special mention. What began as a requested recommendation for restaurants, resulted in an amazing evening and memorable dinner without a single hassle. Ben offered dining options, handled the reservations for us, provided directions, and then the restaurant treated us as VIPs simply because Le Meridien had set up our reservation!

Our accommodations were immaculate! Well furnished, very clean, beautiful views, extremely quiet, and a very comfortable bed! It was a memorable stay.

No matter when or why I travel to the Bay Area in the future, this centrally located hotel will be our destination.</Review><Pics>[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipMvusXK5GRo11J0C2D2NntFsmAP3CXnOldDggeM=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipPuaSDvivXdU5PLKpoPlHJXeaxLT0hzRgf6kTs8=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipNM7rJFHb8jBsSMjoOoDHhdj0nRE2Lgga-UgALJ=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]<//Pics>< resp>

<rating>5< /rating><text>Wow! Color me impressed!

Our company had an event in San Francisco  and we had reservations, via the company, here at Le Meridien.

I had my printed reservation paperwork and it wasn't even needed. Miss Laura just asked for my ID, Credit Card info and to verify my phone number. Everything started out smooth.

I headed to my assigned room and the cleaning lady informed me that it wasn't quite ready yet. So I just went back to the desk and let Miss Laura know that I would be back. I'd grab some food and then go to my room. After some clarity, she just made arrangements for a different room.

The customer service here is awesome. Then again, I wasn't screaming or yelling that there was any kind of an issue. üòâ

So if you are in the area or if your company wants to plan an event, reach out to Le Meridien and stay a night or two.

As a side note for those who like to sight see, Le Meriden is located less than half a mile from the Exploratorium, with restaurants, bars and shops all around. A little farther down the road and you have pier 39. Come one, come all and let Le Meridien take care of your weekend. (And/or business trip.)</text><pics>[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipMikUOSEp2ANnMq3tFDXUWnRFBZGnDcRzjpsO-9=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipNRSRwBoazvXFPU-BGWuQK-NlFfjoao37R_eKXX=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipPMLkY_q7XU3U3YeCXurcG_x2kYSndKb4BJxmKU=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipNl6zoGEmYel0W4ST-HSWiBRmVkF6eWAkx58P0r=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipOcGlvqjujKETYrn4GLZAmy5SgWGSzcJQxJjYzb=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]<//pics><response>{'time': 1581268680174, 'text': 'Thank you for sharing all of this with your fellow travelers. <date>1542737171214<//date><Gmap_id>0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//Gmap_id>< Text>
The lobby/rooms were quite nice and up to date contrary to the exterior of the hotel, as a gold member I was upgraded to a Bay view room and thoroughly enjoyed my stay, there aren't any swimming pools here.  The Montgomery Bart station is walking distance as is the pier.  The entrance is on Clay street and not on Battery street in case of transportation instructions.  The room was nice although there wasn't a master switch for the whole room, so after turning on all the lights, you'd need to go one by one to turn everything off.  The bathroom although large, is a little dated and could use some remodeling to match the rest of the hotel. The bathroom products by MALIN+GOETZ were nice. There is free Illy coffee in the 3rd floor and a Starbucks across the street.</Text>
< name>

<user_name>Matt Derickson<//user_name>< Date>
1579543013563</Date>
<rate>4</rate>< review>
The staff were incredible and polite, so no problems there. The hotel location was perfectly positioned in the financial district, which allowed easy access to a majority of the things we wanted to do. However, the hotel was a little dated. It didn't have a smart TV like most Marriott hotels and the interior color scheme, blinds, and furniture were cool ten years ago. Overall, the service was impeccable but the rooms were not to our taste. My wife and I would visit again if the cost or accommodations were adjusted to be representative of each other.<//review>

< review>
I stay here whenever I can! The decor is very pretty and the bar/restaurant downstairs never disappoints. It can get a bit crowded with 40 and over crowd though on a Friday night. The rooms are usually great. The only time I had an issue was when the housekeeper missed an entire bag of McDonalds behind the curtain. Who eats McDonald's when you're at this place anyway? The beds and pillows are very comfortable and clean. The location can't be beat since you're at the Embarcadero Center and a 40-50 minute walk or so (speed varies!) from Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf.</review>

<review>Nice hotel. The parking is ridiculously expensive. Park a few blocks away at the St. Mary's garage. It is cheaper and not far. The staff was great. The one gal at the front desk got me a table on new years eve for dinner when nothing was available! There is parking at the meters outside the bldg at night for free. Check times and street signs. Safeway is not far and lots of dinning close by. You can walk to fisherman's wharf if you want and the pier is just blocks away. My room had a balcony overlooking the bay.<//review>< Pics>

<user_name>SteveUK</user_name><Time>1568332800000</Time><rating>None</rating>< review>
Le Meridien is a fabulous hotel to stay in.
Although targeted at the business market we were a family on holiday and found the hotel met our needs perfectly.
It was quiet at night and walking distance to China town and the Italian restaurants in North Beach.
Not too far either to Fishermans Wharfe and Union Square.
Rooms were wonderful and beds were very comfy.
If you want a view ask for a room with City View.</review>

Built in 1989 and opened just months after the Loma Prieta earthquake this architectural juggernaut has suffered only a bit being forever overshadowed by the iconic San Francisco trans America pyramid. Like Oakland standing on the shadow of the glittering big sister princess SF, Le M√©ridien would ne called handsome to the beauty of the one of a kind pyramid. But don‚Äôt let the painfully obvious distract you. Look deeper within the Marriott international‚Äôs le M√©ridien. I try to book a high floor queen suite with the in the 19 stack. On the Highest floors the views from the almost industry wide specialty feature: a balcony with seating!! Are postcard ready. What do you say when you write back home and talk about the special place in history sf will always have?  To see it is to believe it. Go on and splurge a little. After all, you can‚Äôt take it with you, except in digital format.<//review>

I received the free WiFi after they got me to sign up for Marriott Bonvoy.

I did all the steps they told me at the front desk. I never got WiFi for my phone. I eventually got WiFi for my laptop BUT every three minutes, the WiFi would stop working. I would have to disconnect and reconnect the WiFi. Every three minutes. That was for my room. The WiFi in the lobby was horrible too.

I was in San Francisco on a business trip, and I couldn't get any work done in my hotel due to the WiFi.

I had to leave my hotel room to find some WiFi when I needed to get some work done.

You won't see me here again.</review>

<Text>My family stayed at Le Meridien for the weekend as we were attending a family wedding next door.  We had two rooms, one which was not ready at arrival but was ready within the hour.  My son arrived straight from the airport and had to immediately connect to the internet to take a college final and the internet was fine, no problems.  The rooms were clean, large and well laid out.  Staff was welcoming, helpful and every one was just as nice as the next.  The concierge did her best to find us a last minute dinner reservation for 13 to no avail as we did not plan ahead but all worked out fine. She would have kept trying until something was found but we were okay on our own.   
The following day, as we were walking out to the wedding I received a frantic call that the bride needed something last minute. I was able to go to concierge, explain what I needed and leave for wedding-the concierge handled it and upon return to hotel before reception let me know I would receive  a call to pick up item so bride has what was needed by end of night.  All done with a s,I Le on their faces.  
We wish we didn‚Äôt live so close so we had an excuse to come back!  Don‚Äôt hesitate to stay at Le Meridien, located close to Union Square, North Beach, pier 39 and the Ferry b
building.  Perfect location and wonderful staff!<//Text>< resp>

My family stayed at Le Meridien for the weekend as we were attending a family wedding next door.  We had two rooms, one which was not ready at arrival but was ready within the hour.  My son arrived straight from the airport and had to immediately connect to the internet to take a college final and the internet was fine, no problems. The concierge did her best to find us a last minute dinner reservation for 13 to no avail as we did not plan ahead but all worked out fine. She would have kept trying until something was found but we were okay on our own.   
The following day, as we were walking out to the wedding I received a frantic call that the bride needed something last minute. I was able to go to concierge, explain what I needed and leave for wedding-the concierge handled it and upon return to hotel before reception let me know I would receive  a call to pick up item so bride has what was needed by end of night. <text>The property is dated but clean. It is close to major tourist attractions and is at a walkable distance to the pier. Hence convenient for tourist explorations around the city. The property itself isn't very astonishing & the rooms & decor is pretty dated. 

During my stay, there wasn't a (significant) recognition of my Titanium Elite status & no room upgrades were provided. The property doesn't have a lounge and the breakfast offered at the restaurant is just meh. It was one of the "restricted" continental breakfast I had in a full service Marriott recently. 

In short, pick this property if you really need to be close to the pier and if the rates are discounted. For a full price, there are many other Marriott's in the city which are far better than Le Meridian SF.<//text>< Resp>

<name>Ritesh Shah<//name><Time>1505402548006</Time>< rating>
5< /rating>
< Review>
My short stay here was great!

I arrived late in the night after fighting flight delays all evening. I was greeted immediately and the concierge began to review my reservation and carried out his script of information - short, thorough, and simple, which was about as much as I could handle given the timing.

I was given a double bed room, which was ample for just me. I found the accommodations very comfortable and the ease of finding all the essentials was great. There was a charging port for my electronics right next to my bed, and I was able to easily access and use the iron to get my clothes ready for the morning.

The bed was firm and easy to fall asleep in. The bed was lined with plenty of blankets, and I was able to modify the temperature in the room to my specifications with ease.

In the morning, the breakfast was great - full continental! Definitely go for the russet potatoes! I added a bit of Tabasco sauce for a hearty start to the day.

Overall - the ease from checking in and checking out was the best part. I am hoping for more stays in the future!</Review>

< review>
Reception staff was very friendly. Evening room service from Steven, and chicken quesadilla were very good. <Pictures>[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipOHth2WE9HLPtm_IUKkseIvGw_ZEKaDdgp6phZr=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]< /Pictures>< Gmap_id>
0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f</Gmap_id>
<username>Huyen Nguyen</username>< text>
We spent a Labor Day weekend here and it was pretty nice.
Though there were some issues

‚Ä¢ The parking fee is $75 a day. So we parked at the Embarcadero Center $35 a day. I mean, we drove all the way from LA to SF, and we have to pay $75 for parking while staying at the hotel, it doesn‚Äôt make sense.

‚Ä¢ To be able to connect WiFi, you have to pay $14 or so for a day, or if you are a Marriott member, then it‚Äôs free.
I didn‚Äôt really pay attention to the smaller print under the price that it was free for a Marriott  member, so we didn‚Äôt really connect to WiFi .
We do have unlimited att service so it wasn‚Äôt a big deal. Though it is really something that I can‚Äôt understand why it‚Äôs being charged.

‚Ä¢Along the hallway there is a water dispenser with fruits inside, which is amazing ! I just wish they could have used normal glasses, instead of so many plastic cups there. They can do better for the environment!

Overall it was a pleasant stay, I just wish there weren‚Äôt so many extra charges for standard services.<//text>

< user_name>
unhappywithSPG< /user_name>
< time>
1514592000000</time>
<Rate>None<//Rate>< Review>
My family and I stayed at this location day after Christmas. We had 2 Jr Suites and 1 full suite reserved, all with views. We were celebrating my father's 90th birthday and had requested an early checkin. I had called in ahead of time.

- Upon arrival at 3pm (note, not even an early checkin), our rooms were not ready. The staff was less than accommodating, and we had to escalate to the manager. 
- Our suite, meant to accommodate 3 people had 1 hand towel and two bath towels, no wash clothes.
- The beds in the rooms had no fitted sheets, and just one flat sheet covering the mattress (no cover for the duvet). I called housekeeping and was told that because of Christmas, the hotel was short on linen!!!!!!!
- The pullout sofa was very uncomfortable, with minimal padding.
- The rooms had no coffee machines.
- There was NO recognition of my father's special birthday, despite several requests.
- I am an SPG (and corporate) member, but they told me because we had booked through Expedia, our rooms do not qualify for the free wifi.

On the positive side:
- The views of the rooms were great.
- Proximity to embarcadero and Ferry building was great.
- The valet staff was very attentive.</Review>

<rate>None</rate><Review>My husband and I have stayed here once before and loved it, so we thought it would be the perfect place to stay to ring in the new year. We were told that we could have a room on a lower floor (5) now or, as SPG members, could be upgraded to a higher floor but would have to come back at 3pm to get our room key, as the room wasn't ready yet. Of course we decided to do this and promptly checked our luggage with the bellhop. We ended up coming back at 4:15pm, well after the 3pm check in time stated on our reservation (and reiterated by the desk clerk), only to be told that our room was still not ready. While waiting, I overheard 2 other desk clerks tell other guests that their rooms were also not ready, as the hotel had had many late check out requests for that day, as late as 2pm. Long story short (ha!) we were told our room would still not be ready for another 45 minutes, yet by this point we had already recovered our luggage from the bellhop and were supposed to meet friends at 5pm. After much time spent researching available rooms, the desk clerk ended up giving us a lower room floor (6) that was less than what our reservation had stated (king superior) with no upgrades, points, or anything to make up for our wait or their lack of planning. When I asked about the wireless code, she said it was not part of our room package. The room itself was fine - no view, mediocre bathtub/shower, comfy bed - but I was disappointed in the service and will not plan on staying here again. < text>
PROS
- Location is close to FiDi, BART, and all the downtown areas you need to get to
- Malin & Goetz bath products
- Super comfy bed
- Nice view of the Bay Bridge
- Awesome staff

CONS
- Sound insulation in the rooms is awful (bring earplugs)
- Not a single vegetarian entree on the menu (surprising for a hotel in SF)
- Had to ask for more shampoo, etc.
- Way overpriced

Overall, it's a nice hotel. Not the best I've ever stayed in, but it's nice. I wouldn't recommend it, mostly because I think it's about twice as expensive as it's worth. But if you don't mind paying extra, go for it!< /text>

<Rate>None<//Rate>< Text>
I travel to SF for work frequently, and before moving to DC used to live in SF for 12 years. My favorite hotel there has become the Le Meridien. Perfect location, walking distance to both the Embarcadero and Ferry Plaza, and also Chinatown/North Beach. It's also a long but fun waterfront walk to ATT Park during baseball season, which saves the hassle of parking near the ballpark. Rooms are large, comfortable and well maintained. Most importantly, the staff at the front desk and concierge are excellent, and very helpful. Highly recommended.</Text>

Location is perfect for business, within walking distance of all my meetings. Probably not so good for weekend stays, unless the price is right. 1391904000000</time>

< gmapID>
0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f< /gmapID>
< Review>
It's been a few years since I've stayed here. I'm looking back at my review from four years ago and wondering what I was thinking. While this Le Meridien is classy and comfy, it's in need of a re-vamp to keep it on par with four or five stars.

The location can't be beat if you want to be in super close proximity to the hundreds of companies in the immediate financial district. However, like many reviews have highlighted, the area is dead at night (which may be a plus for some weary business travelers). It's also a quick 3-minute walk to the Ferry Building which, if you've never been to San Fran, is a place you're going to want to spend as much time in as possible.

Using my SPG Suite Night Awards, I was upgraded to a Business Suite which was a fairly fascinating experience. You walk in to the main bedroom--fairly spacious with a large king bed, chair, dresser and large TV. There is also a teeny balcony with a chair and great views of the bay (see photos). Occupying a corner of the hotel, this Suite also features a large full office complete with large desk, credenza and yes, A FAX MACHINE. You know y'all, I was so thankful bc I had so much faxing to do during my 2014 business trip. The bathroom is large with a huge window for plenty of light. However, it has a nasty shower/tub combination not particularly fitting of a supposed luxury hotel. The room was clean, the sheets soft. the towels worn and reminding me of ones I had seen at Motel 6. My takeaway on the room is that it's a few years overdue for a total refresh.

No coffee makers in rooms. Annoying especially bc the free coffee in the hotel restaurant is only available in the morning.

FREE SHOE SHINE!

With so many awesome hotel choices in San Fran, I'd give LM another shot if the rates were really low.<//Review>

<Response>None<//Response><text>My wife and I traveled to San Francisco for the Memorial Day weekend and found a great rate at this hotel that included parking (regularly $52.00/night) as part of the hotel package for under $200.00/night.

The hotel is very modern - very nice lobby and great location that is close to shopping. It is located in more of a "business" district - but is within walking distance (20 minute walk) to Pier 39, and a short walk (2-3 minutes) to Chinatown and Nob Hill area.

Room was on a high floor and had a limited view of the Bay Bridge. The bed was very comfortable - great TV and very nice bathroom. We did not utilize the hotel restaurant or bar.

No acknowledgement of gold status on arrival.
No upgrades etc.
When I inquired about wifi cost for gold status was given a bit of a lecture about booking using the correct channels (Someone else books my hotels normally) and including the number on the booking (it was on my confirmation email but not the reservation)
Lighting in the room consists of a light-up picture frame that shines in your face and several standalone lamps that are difficult to reach from the bed (I rearranged). Reading lamp would be helpful, as well as a bed-reachable switch to shut everything off. 
"desk" area is a terrible barstool arrangement - we've got three people for 5-7 nights each (about $6K) in town who need to work but can't use the room to work due to terrible stool and bad 'desk' height. 
Food pretty average and pricey.
Decent location. Good view. Decent bed. 
Still here for a couple of nights if any management want to rectify but it seems poor staff attendance is an ongoing issue based on other reviews.< /text>

<Time>1553558400000<//Time><userid>None<//userid>< gmapID>
0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//gmapID>

<Pictures>None<//Pictures><user_id>None</user_id>< gmap_id>
0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//gmap_id>
< Text>
This hotel is the most convenient Starwood property to San Francisco's Embarcadero Center, which makes it a highly convenient location for business. It's also walking distance to lots of great restaurants.

Rooms are modern, very comfortable, and by San Francisco standards, spacious. Most of the times I've stayed here as a Platinum guest, I've been upgraded to a suite; these are huge, have great views, and have a elegant, contemporary look. This is definitely comfort over glitz.

The bar is a great place to have a drink, and the food there is good as well; it's quiet enough to have a meeting or a pleasant conversation. This is a business and upscale leisure travelers sort of scene, not a "buzz" kind of place.

The restaurant serves a terrific breakfast (a la carte), and it's a great place for a business meeting -- quiet, comfortable, service is attentive but unobtrusive. There's no particular reason to eat lunch or dinner here, though, with the abundance of other excellent eateries in the area.

The meeting rooms here are also decent, although the wi-fi reach isn't as strong as one might consider ideal.

Overall, if you're looking to stay in the Embarcadero Center area, and you're willing to pay a little extra, this is well worthwhile.<//Text>

<gmap_id>0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f< /gmap_id><rate>None<//rate><userid>None< /userid><Pictures>None< /Pictures><Text>Below was the email I sent to the hotel the last night I stayed there. After all the things they failed to meet as a SPG category 5 hotel, they yet again ignored this email. There was no apology, nor recognition of receiving it. Absolute radio silence.

Hi there,
It's my first time staying with your hotel and I feel I'd like to share my not so satisfying experience so far.

8/1
I checked in and immediately noticed the careless house keeping job done in this room. The keeper placed two bottles of shampoo and no shower gel, the shower cap box is empty inside.

8/2
I left two dollar bills on the side table for tips. When I returned, I was surprised to find that there was no refill of the the shampoo, conditioner, or lotion. The keeper has not checked and found the shower gel is missing. The tips were taken but a cup of water on the table was spilled and the keeper did not bother to wipe it. Left the water on the table and some water soaked Meridien notepads. I took the plastic cups in the room to use on my Sunday picnic and they were not filled either.

I hung my clothes in the closet and saw the SUPER DUSTY shades of the closet door as the light in the closet turned on automatically. Later on, when I brushed my teeth, I somehow got to a right angle and spotted the filthy inside of the toilet rim.

I have decided the housekeeping department is terribly managed and has no cleaning SOP, which I didn't expect from a SPG Category 5 facility. I also decided that the room is probably not cleaner with housekeeping so I declined my service for the next day.

8/3
I called to request for my water and an extra towel since I declined house keeping for the day. A 50-60 year old African American guy delivered it to my room. When I said thank you, he might be disappointed that I was not tipping him. Abruptly, he turned and walked away without giving me another look. I could't help but wonder what is happening to your hotel.

Finally, your WiFi is terrible. It is super slow for even accessing web pages. It is slower than any of the hotels I have stayed in China.This is not right to be slower than a country where internet is censored and this is shameful to have that speed in the Bay Area. I saw other people complained about the same thing. Please have it fixed.

I just had the most satisfying stay in your St. Regis Chengdu. As a customer, I saw a team working together and cared for every details of their job to be able to do it so right. As the same SPG Category 5 hotel, you are failing customer expectation and your reputation.

All the negative comments being said, I think the front desk staff is the best in this hotel. They are welcoming, quick to take action on service calls, and professional.

That was all I wanted to say and I wish you run a better hotel in the future.<//Text>< response>

< username>
Mildred Griffin</username>
<Date>1489659989886<//Date>< Rating>
5</Rating>
< review>
Room was clean and spacious and we got a high room with a great view. It was great that you could open the window partially to get fresh air while sleeping. The hotel is a short walk to the Ferry Building, Chinatown, a little further to the North Beach district, and close to one of the cable car route stops.Just be aware, being the financial district, many of the cafes/eateries are only open during the day Mon-Fri. No breakfast is included but there are no shortage of eateries close by Mon-Fri. On a weekend you may need to resort to Subway. There's a bar downstairs where we had a cocktail, they offer small bites and also there is a small adjacent restaurant for meals which appeared reasonably priced.</review>

SBTX</user_name>
<time>1355270400000</time>< Rating>
None<//Rating>
<Review>We didn't see that the hotel was under renovations when we booked online. So, when we arrived and realized they were in the middle of a renovation, I thought the rooms would be noisy, and expected an impatient staff. I was pleasantly surprised, and in fact, received outstanding and warm customer service. The bell man was very personable and eager to show us the shortcut to the elevator - even though I am sure he'd done it a thousand times. The front desk, even though in a make shift lounge due to the construction, were smiling, quick in checking in, genuinely upbeat. We were on the Starwood Preferred floor, with a beautiful view. The room was immaculate, and we enjoyed the amenities. We heard no noise, and slept great through the night. We both travel quite a bit for work, and typically stay at 4 star hotels and up. The most important things in our experience are 1) the cleanliness of the room 2) the ease of location / amenities 3) the service. Le Meriden San Francisco was right on spot with delivering every thing we needed to make the stay enjoyable.< /Review>< pics>

<response>None< /response><Rating>None< /Rating><Review>Why do I choose Le Meridien first when I visit San Francisco?

Location: It's nestled in the Financial District, and I can walk to several great places from the hotel (City Lights Books, the Financial Building, Union Square). When I'm unsure of where to go, the concierge, valet, AND door man come together to brainstorm with me.

Service: I've always been respected and treated like a friend at the hotel. All staff I've met have been kind and helpful.

Art!: The rooms and marketing are adorned with local student art work. What a great aesthetic investment!

Amenities: The workout room has a range of LifeStyle fitness equipment that is well maintained and contemporary.

SPG: I get points for having the Le Meridien experience each time I visit. How neat is that?</Review></record>

< Rating>
None</Rating>
<text>Overall, the hotel was a big disappointment. For starters, I received no warning whatsoever that the hotel was undergoing a major renovation. Even locating the "front door" to the hotel (behind the construction wall) was difficult! Once inside the hotel, guests are forced to take what is essentially a freight elevator up to the second floor where you then find a makeshift checkin desk. As I was accompanied by a business associate, these conditions were rather embarassing. And things didn't get any better... Notwithstanding only an hour earlier SPG.COM reflected that I'd received a Platinum upgrade to a Studio Suite, I was told at check-in that I was actually assigned to an "Executive" room (the manager on duty rather unapologetically insisted the change was due to a need to "balance the hotel" whatever that means... Of course this so-called Executive room (1509) was directly adjacent to the elevators, included a dirty plastic cup atop the dresser, and had none of the usual amenities (not even complimentary bottled water which I thought was standard)... I had to go to the front desk to remind them to send water bottles up to the room. Would not have booked this hotel had I known of the renovation and it's pretty outrageous the hotel conceals this fact from its guests (website contains no "special conditions" advisory no any other hint of what guests can expect). My only positive comment would be to acknowledge the good customer service shown by the young woman who checked me in. She was genuinely sorry for the last minute swap from a suite to a standard room and I appreciated that she tried (unsuccessfully) to have the manager find an alternative.</text><Pics>None< /Pics><Response>None< /Response>< GmapID>
0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f</GmapID>
</record></dataset><record>
<user>None</user><username>JagsFan<//username><date>1359331200000<//date>< rate>

<Text>I arrived early and was told the room was not available, however the staff was very accommodating along the way. As a platinum member, I was already upgraded to a suite, but the staff upgraded us to the 23rd floor in a luxury suite with an outstanding view.

0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//gmapID>
< text>
I work in the neighborhood but needed a hotel for a weekend in the City -- first time at this property and would definitely come back. Got upgraded to a 2 room balcony suite with an amazing panoramic view from the Bay Bridge over to North Beach!

Great location -- a bit quiet on weekends, but close to Ferry Building for Farmer's Market, and plenty of great resturaunts close by.

Staff was great, we were able to check in early. Great little business center to print out Opera tickets, and no problem getting a taxi.

The bed was SO comfortable (and I'm picky). Bedroom has floor to ceiling windows, but great drapes that blocked out the morning sun.

Only complaint -- 2 chairs on balcony would be nice, we had to drag a desk chair outside. I also would've liked a sofa in the sitting room, instead of several individual easy chairs.

Will definitely stay here again and recommend to my business colleagues when they're in town.< /text>

0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f</Gmap_id>
< Review>
The hotel was amazing. The hotel room was clean bright and modern. There are minor things that make the hotel excellent. The staff is extremely courteous, proactively reaching for the door to hold open and more than enthusiastic to answer your questions. The room has minor touches that exude quality such as the soft close cabinet drawers and USB charging ports at the bedside and desk. Beautiful stone surfaces adorn each counter top. I can not overstate this, this hotel is fantastic. A minor gripe is that since it is in the financial district, a lot of the restaurants near it are closed on Saturday and Sunday. However, if you're willing to walk, Union square and Chinatown are only minutes away. This is actually a bonus for me. This makes the hotel more quiet at night but is still within quick walking distance from a lot of the must see sights.< /Review>

<rate>None</rate><Review>Love the Hotel location which is right across the street from Embarcadero Shopping Center 3-4 blocks from Pier 1/2 which on Saturdays have the best FARMERS MARKET!!! 5-6 blocks away from China town and 7-8 blocks from Union Square, overall everything to me was within walking distant. If you can‚Äôt walk then there is always a doorman to help catch you a cab, but this trip we tried UBER for the first time which was great too. The Front Desk check in was a breeze, she was a little busy but gave us a great room, on a great floor with a view of the bay bridge which we LOVED! The only thing is there is 4 of us girls, and we only had 1 umbrella on a rainy weekend. When we went to the concierge desk to ask for more, they told us that it was only 1 per room and they did not have any more available, now that is hard to believe because in a city that rains a lot why would you not have more umbrellas available for your guest upon request. So we were disappointed that we could not get more umbrellas to accommodate us. Then on Sunday our checkout day, we needed extra towels so I venture into the hall to find house-keeping and their cart. I ask the lady for if I could get extra towels, not only did I get attitude from her for asking she only gave me one and told me I need to call housekeeping next time if I wanted towels which to me is horrible customer service. I would of given this hotel a 5 star but my incidents of lack of customer service ruined it for me. I would recommend the location and hope that if you book this place you would encounter a person who is willing to help because those that were not willing to help made me feel like I do not want to go back. But then again the ones that did give us great customer service like the Saturday housekeeping lady did makes you want to go back. <text>From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly and helpful. Check-in was quick, the concierge staff provided good recommendations and provided solid food recommendations. Our room was nice and the floor to ceiling windows that opened to a view of the Bay Bridge were a perk. The hotel location was convenient to Embarcadero Center where you can walk above street level all the way down to the Ferry Terminal. At the end of the day, though, the bed was too stiff and we were placed in a room next to the elevators... so aside from perhaps a 3 hour reprieve, we heard the elevators all night during our stay. <Name>WorldTraveler73< /Name>< date>
1370044800000< /date>
<rate>None<//rate>< text>
Classy hotel in San Francisco's Financial district. This means that it is somewhat removed from the major sights (Union Square is a 10-minute walk away), but is therefore very quiet and peaceful on the weekends. Masculine tony d√©cor throughout the hotel (really like the color scheme and marble). As a SPG Platinum member, almost always get a nice upgrade to a suite with spectacular views of the Bay. Fitness center is well-equipped and service is also top-notch. One slight drawback is that the neighborhood shuts down early and the hotel bar also closes relatively early on the weekends, so you will just need to take a taxi to access the vibrant San Francisco nightlife (which was not a big deal for me).</text>

< Review>
Le M√©ridien San Francisco, while situated in the midst of San Francisco's business district, is a bit of an oasis. It provides the guest with a more relaxing atmosphere than what you might expect.

Le M√©ridien San Francisco is located within easy walking distance of Union Square, Market Street, Chinatown and the business district.

We were upgraded to a suite, which was very spacious and provided us with a beautiful view of the city. The check in process was flawless as was the parking. The workout facilities met my requirements.

All in all, I would have no reservation about revisiting Le M√©ridien San Francisco during another visit to San Francisco.< /Review>

<text>Hotel was great! When we arrived, they upgraded our stay from "Classic King" to "Executive King" (still unsure why), but it was a wonderful stay and pleasant surprise! :) 

The room was cozy and spacious. The only complaint I would have is the walls are extremely thin, to where you could hear water running from the next room, and the pipes. I've never had that experience in other hotels, so I would say that is one flaw I had. Didn't get much sleep because our neighbors and folks staying above us decided to take hour long showers between the hours of 2-5am. 

Other than that, the hotel was located in a nice proximity to attractions nearby- just a short uber/walk/drive away if need be.</text>< Rate>

<date>1327363200000</date><rate>None</rate><review>We received an excellent deal on a large, comfortable suite, and the view (with balcony) of the Bay Bridge all the way to North Beach was stunning.

The bathroom and amenities were great (even a window in the bathroom), though there was no separate shower.

The bed was very comfortable. The furniture in the room was tasteful modern, but a bit hard and unwelcoming. A plush seating area to match the plushness of the bed would have been perfect.

One strange thing, however, which I didn't even consider until I noted the number of Starwood Hotels in the San Francisco area while 'registering'. It became necessary for us to stay in San Francisco longer than we had planned, and when we asked the front desk whether we could possibly extend our stay, they regretfully told us that they were completely booked. Understandable, but that was where it ended. No checking other Starwood Hotels, not even a referral toward one or the other. It seems an overlooked opportunity.

Overall, though, very nice hotel.< /review>< pictures>

<Rating>None</Rating><review>This hotel is one that I usually choose when I have to be in San Francisco for business or pleasure.

This time I was in town for work, and before checking in that evening I already had a CRAZY day full of non-stop meetings and putting out fires on deals. By the time I got to check-in that evening, I had been up for about 15 hours already and was frazzled. The front desk staff recognized me as a Platinum member, gave me a complimentary drink certificate, and then said "Oh, and we have a really nice room for you, hope do you get some rest and enjoy your stay." I had booked a standard room, and I remembered they were pretty nice anyway, so didn't think too much about that.

Then I went to my room, and I had been upgraded to a humongous, well appointed suite -- the NY Suite! It was extremely comfortable and had great views of the city and the Bay Bridge. I had all my local friends come and hang out in my living room that weekend, and it was a blast. Really made me feel that Platinum membership had some great benefits, and that the hotel staff really cared. They honestly could have just given me the room I had booked, and everything would have been fine...but they really did manage to impress me with the suite.

I will definitely come back and recommend to all my friends.<//review>< pics>

< text>
My girlfriend and I went to San Francisco for our anniversary. We were given a hotel room upgrade and free drinks coupons to their wonderful bar (333 Bar). Our room was amazing! It was a corner room with a balcony that faced the Bay Bridge. We could see the LED light show on the bridge at night and the water front as well. The only bad thing was there were protesters at 7 am one morning with a blow horn, but we were already awake. The bathroom was great too. It had a shower and separate bath tub, and the water pressure was bliss. I loved the hotel location because it was downtown. My girlfriend and I loved to walk downtown and we were only a few minutes from Little Italy and China town. I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again.< /text>

<time>1403654400000< /time><Rate>None< /Rate>< Text>
Stayed at Le Meridien for vacation.
Was awoken from a nap from the fire alarm in the hotel going off and a scary message to "cease activity" and proceed to the nearest exit. Turns out it was a false alarm. I think this should have been monitored more closely and possibly stopped sooner since it turns out a non-english speaking person got confused and pulled the fire lever right near the check in counter when there was no fire. I was also awoken from angry staff/locals boycotting the hotel since, according to them, Le Meridien doesn't treat staff fairly. Who knows the truth. Point is, picketers were loud, obnoxious, and tried to stop me and my mother as we left the building and shoved information pieces of the boycot in our faces. Other than that, staff NOT boycotting were friendly, beds were comfortable, free cofee was good. The Manager comped our dinner for the inconvienience of the boycott being so disruptive. Facility was clean and concierge was super helpful and recommended some great spots for breakfast. Wished some of the breakfast items for hotel room service were more affordable because we would have stayed in more.</Text>

<Rating>None< /Rating><Review>My fiancee and I stayed here recently and we couldn't be happier. As a Platinum member, they upgraded us to a brand new suite with a bay view balcony. They're in the process of revamping all the rooms and you will not be disappointed.
We checked out for 2 days and went up to Napa, prior to leaving we asked for the same room upon returning and they had no problem giving it to us. Finally, our flight got canceled (we live in Boston) and they extended us, again without having to move rooms.
The lobby and front desk staff we're great, always greeted with a smile and they remembered who we were.
While it is in the financial district, we walked pretty much everywhere we wanted to go; COIT Tower, Fishermans Wharf, Union Sq, China Town, North Beach...ect, ect. Granted, some of these places are over a mile away so be prepared but it is a great place to stay if you're willing to take a trek (given all the great food in SF, we needed it!).
Look forward to coming back to see these folks again< /Review><pics>None</pics><Response>None</Response>< Gmap_id>

<user_id>None</user_id>< name>
Dan1</name>
<date>1496361600000</date><rating>None</rating>< Text>
I visit San Francisco regularly but pay a visit to Le Meridien San Francisco the first time which I also believe will be the last one...
Hotel reception or managers are just not available by email. I sent an email ahead of my stay as I had some concerns reading reviews about noise associated with demonstrations they had around the hotel. I wanted to make sure that I am getting high floor room and if possible direction which is away from the expected demonstration. 
I booked a Studio Suite with king size bed.

To get a response from the assistance front desk MGR took 3 reminders as well as 3/4 emails to SPG Platinum Customer Services.... it was very clear at this point that this hotel is poorly managed but as it was a short stay and I arrive late to book another hotel I decided to stay but would gladly share my experience with you so you may have the benefit of knowing in advance what you are to expect.

Front desk assistant confirmed a high floor room, I was allocated 14th floor ( out of 24 floors) I would not call it specifically a very high floor.
I was told that my room was upgraded - yes it was to the next category but ( and there is always a but in this property) with small queen size bed which is very small generally and specifically to a suite.
As SPG life time member I was given breakfast taken which I was told by reception can give a $30 credit. Again when trying it this morning there was a but.... I left the vouchers at the resturant as I have no intention to start my mornings with long discussion about the voucher and the small prints associated with it.... 
no need for the hotel manager to respond. He has ample of opportunities to do so.</Text>

<Rate>None<//Rate>< Text>
My wife and I are pretty critical of hotels and have stayed in some nice ones around the globe. This one in San Francisco is a nice, simple, clean hotel with friendly service and in a strategically good, but not busy location (as opposed to Union Square). Our room was nicely appointed, bed comfortable and room quiet with a nice view of the TransAmerica building and the Bay. Only drawback and reason for taking away a star on Facilities is the $60 a night parking. Ridiculous.</Text>

<Name>Kaleberg< /Name><Time>1324512000000<//Time><Rate>None</Rate><Text>We have been staying at this hotel since before it was a Le Meridien, and it has always been our oasis in San Francisco. The rooms are large and comfortable. They are quiet and the windows have both great views and great black out curtains. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and hard working. They will go the extra mile. We will definitely be coming back.

Our only complaints are minor. The bathroom has sliding doors which compromise privacy, and the Christmas music in the lobby and elevators was way TOO LOUD. We weren't the only guests to notice this, and it led to some amusing banter in the elevators. We could retreat to our room, but this must have been rough on the staff.< /Text>< Pictures>

< text>
On Feb 20/2013, I called reservation to book 4 rooms and gave my SPG # requesting them to credit all the points to my account for I was paying for all the 4 rooms.

On May 23/2013, I called reservation to book 2 more rooms and gave my SPG # for crediting all the points to my account and again I was paying for all the 6 rooms.

On July 12/2013, I booked 1 more room and also quoted my SPG number for credit.

I specifically mentioned in each of the bookings that all the starwood points to be credited to my SPG account. None of your staff taking my reservation had ever informed me that I could only get points for 3 rooms. Had I known this I would have booked my family members in hotels of their choice to collect reward points of their own.

Starwood hotels should not limit the number of eligible SPG starpoints for family booking. I wanted my family to stay together by offerring to pay for all the 7 rooms but I can only get reward points for only 3 rooms!!! Very disappointed.</text>

None< /rate>
< Text>
I actively avoid properties that allow smoking anywhere on the premises, and chose to stay at this property in part because it appeared in the SPG search for smoke-free properties. On the Features page, it states "Experience a fresh approach at this Le M√©ridien ‚Äì a completely smoke-free environment." and "100% Non-Smoking Rooms and Facilities."

HOWEVER, on the Announcements page it states the REAL policy, which is "All guest rooms and public spaces in the hotel are now 100% non-smoking. A 250 USD penalty will be charged for smoking in guest rooms. Smoking is permitted on outdoor room balconies and on the Park Grill terrace only." The room balconies is a big deal, because some rooms without balconies do have sliding glass doors to the outside, which allows smoke from adjacent rooms' balconies to waft in. It also creates the potential for guest confusion about whether the room has a "balcony" area. When I checked in, I had one of these rooms and it did smell heavily of smoke.

I e-mailed SPG and asked that they update the Features page to remove the deceptive information about the smoking policy.< /Text>

<Time>1398124800000</Time>< Rating>

<text>I enjoyed my stay in San Francisco but found the overall hotel staff attitude less than accommodating. The front desk and concierge staff were great. But, the room cleaning staff less so. After each visit, I had to request a face towel and wash cloth. One time I returned to the room to pick up a sweater and the woman cleaning demanded to see my ID. I appreciated her concern for security but she needs to work on her "manners." The bar tender was RUDE on each occasion I visited the bar. Finally the bell men demanded payment for helping transport boxes -- understandably they expected payment and they were certainly going to be tipped generously - but unacceptable for them to to demand payment after the fact. When asked about this "demand," their "supervisor" complained about an earlier failure to "tip" when in fact they had been tipped quite generously. While I understand the need for gratuities in a service job, this behavior seems at odds with the image conveyed by the Meridien. Members of the staff came off as a bit greedy and grasping -- not what one expects from an expensive and highly touted hotel. I live on the east coast which is often maligned for its lack of courtesy and gentility. Yet, I have not had this experience in NYC or Boston hotels. Nonetheless, it's a lovely hotel -- though a bit rough around the edges.<//text>< Pics>

<Rating>None<//Rating><Text>I stayed here for business. The room, while sizable, was dark - carpet, walls, drapes. The bathroom was clean, spacious. The bed was comfortable. The internet was easy to connect and worked very well. The toilet's high-powered (think cruise ship) flushing system had some kinks in it and produced a piercing whistling noise that would last until I flushed it again. Five times this happened during the night. The concierge didn't appear surprised, was very kind, and made arrangements to have it fixed. The hotel is convenient to the financial district, the lobby bar is very pleasant, and the waterfront is only blocks away for a great morning run/walk. Ask for a room with a view of the Bay Bridge so you can see the light show at night.</Text><pictures>None</pictures><response>None</response><gmap_id>0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//gmap_id></record></dataset><record>

< Review>
$600 per night rate. Nice rooms. Decent service. No coffee machines in the rooms. You can order coffee through room service so that you can be gouged even more. Here's the fun part of not having a $10 coffee machine in the room: You get to wander outside the hotels in the dark and either go to Peets or Starbucks. How great is that!!!

$600 a night and no $10 coffee machine.< /Review>

<text>I reserved a room with 2 beds, but was told that none were available when I checked in. I was offered a rollaway bed, which turned out to be uncomfortable. I specifically reserved the room at this hotel because there were 2 beds. The room I was given, which was called a "suite", had a beautiful view which we appreciated, but it didn't make up for the uncomfortable bed. We were repeatedly assured that the rollaway was very comfortable, but it just wasn't. The staff seemed unsympathetic about our situation, with the exception of the gentleman that checked us out.

Also, we were told the rollaway bed would be delivered to our room, but when we returned to the hotel after midnight, we discovered it still had not been delivered.

One more thing, there was a dirty towel folded and hanging on the shower, that I discovered was dirty after I used it! So gross, with 2 red blood stains. I assume that if it were washed properly, their might still be stains, but not blood red.

This is a very nice hotel, and I have stayed here before on my own, but I would hesitate to return with a friend expecting 2 beds, and I will check the towels before I blindly grab and use one!< /text><user_name>PeggyS<//user_name>< pics>

Rburke34<//user_name>
< date>

< rate>
None< /rate>
< review>
I never complain about hotels, and honestly this hotel was a nice place, but for over $400 a night, the issues I had with the internet were too much. I was there for 2.5 days and had a number of business calls. When I first arrived, i couldn't get online, and after the staff telling me for 4 hours that it was fine, someone finally told me internet service had been down for the entire hotel for a few hours with no timetable for return. They told me to go to Starbucks, which I did, and when I came back to check, someone else told me internet had been fine the whole time. When I couldn't log in again, a different person told me they were still having an issue, but would send someone to my room. That person never came, and I was never able to get on. Late night I came back one night and asked about internet, and again, the new staff had no clue and said it must be my computer, even though now multiple other staff members confirmed there were issues. Either way, I just wanted an answer, and options for a solution - which never happened. Horrible experience to be trying to log in for conference calls and having to go to Starbucks and never having a timetable for a solution. Honestly unacceptable for a hotel of this caliber, and for all of the travel that I do for work this was one of the most frustrating experiences I've had.< /review>

Our stay at Le Meridien was very pleasurable. Initially we had a handicapped accessible room (at our request because one of us had a broken ankle) but the accessibility was designed for someone in a wheelchair, not on crutches. We were moved after one day to a junior suite that was excellent in all categories.

The "business center" is minimal and parking is expensive, but other than that everything was great.</text>

<user_id>None</user_id><name>LoveTravel11< /name><time>1395014400000< /time><rating>None<//rating><Review>Well, where to begin.....
This was my first stay at a Le Meridien Hotel and I was excited to experience it. Unfortunately, it wasn't a good experience. I stayed there on two separate nights while in town. The first stay we arrived early and I had a confirmed Suite Night Award for an Executive Suite.

I was given a Junior Suite, which we later found out was not entirely clean. The bathroom trashcan still had trash in it from the last guests and it was missing amenities (lotion....)

This was coupled by the fact that one of the cleaning staff walked in on us while we were changing. Needless to say I was less than pleased. I finally decided to go down stairs and speak to someone at the front desk about the situation. I was offered a two free drinks as a consolation prize and they were willing to send someone up to clean the bathroom again.

At this point, I'm presumably in a not completely clean suite that isn't the suite that I was promised and I feel like I'm two for two on language barriers at the front desk. I want to be fair and say that the staff was very polite and offered me a late check out, platinum amenity., but it is difficult when you kinda feel as though you are putting people out.

A manager did move us to the appropriate suite. She stated that she would address the issues with the room, but it honestly soured the experience. (Work/Birthday Weekend)

Round 2 Saturday night......
The same representative checked us in again and again tried to put me in a junior suite. I attempted to explain to her that I had a confirmed Executive Suite, but it fell upon deaf ears. She explained to me that Starwood doesn't know what suites they have available.....
Well, you know things never go well when you have to explain how a program works. I again felt like was imposing my will on the front desk staff. Ultimately she told me if I was willing to wait she would put me in an Premium Suite.
We waited less than 45 minutes and received a Executive Suite. I immediately went to secure my valuables and found the safe was locked. We waited approximately 30 minutes for engineering to come and unlock the safe for us. He was great, but again lack of attention to detail by the house keeping staff.

That evening we went downstairs to enjoy our consolation prize from the first night and ordered two drinks. The bartender was awesome and when I presented the card I was given, she informed me it was only good for one drink. I actually laughed out loud because when the front desk person gave it to me, he said it was good for the both of us. I told him I think they are only good for one drink, but he reassured me it was good for two. (training issue again)

It isn't the money, it's the principal that I used two Suite Night Awards to ensure we received the right room for our needs. It bothers me that I know more about Starwood than some of the staff.

Let me close with a couple of positive thoughts:
The views from the higher floors are great.
The location is great if you are doing business in the financial district.
The bellmen were great and very attentive.
The bartender was funny and made us feel at home.

I tried to be as fair as possible, but I was really disappointed.< /Review><pictures>None<//pictures><response>None</response><gmapID>0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//gmapID></record>
</dataset><record>

< Review>
I always enjoy my stay at Le Meridien. The employees are solid in all parts of the hotel. In particular, the concierges worked very hard to find a dinner reservation for eight on short notice on a Friday night. They were successful. There is nothing flashy about the rooms, but they are quiet and functional. The hotel is well situated in downtown San Francisco and the fitness center is very nice. My only criticism is the hotel feels the need to play New Age music in the elevators. It really is annoying.<//Review>

< review>
We were staying in SF for a wedding and requested to check in early because the wedding started before official check in time. Not only did they let us check in early, we got upgraded, which was nice because we paid quite a bit for a room here (it was the weekend of some event too). The room was very clean, we got two keys to the room and the lock seemed a little finicky but it worked...eventually. It was a little loud when people would walk in the hallway, but all of the staff we dealt with were very friendly and professional. We did valet our car so we didn't have to worry about parking and the valet staff was awesome too...oh and 4 stars for room comfort because all of the pillows were too squishy for my comfort...< /review>

<GmapID>0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//GmapID><Resp>None</Resp><time>1454544000000< /time><review>Located in the Financial District, for some reason all my Uber and taxi rides dropped me off and picked me up at the bar entrance - not the easiest to drag your luggage through.

Excellent staff and service, especially by Claudia, who is an asset to the hotel. She was able to assist me with each of the room reservations I had for a convention, deliveries, etc.

For the room, each room is designed to have a ‚Äúcorner window‚Äù view looking out from the hotel at the Bay Bridge - a great view, and thankfully the patio doors partially open to let some fresh air in.

I shared this room with a co-worker, and found there was more than enough space for each of us to sleep and work, without feeling cramped in a city like downtown San Francisco.

The gym is located in the basement, with several cardio and weight machines - you may be staring at a mirror image of yourself while running, but at least there is lots of TV.<//review>< user_id>
